channel.title: The code is too large
channel.description:
Hello-
First of all thanks for even reading this. Second of all, I seem to be getting this error pretty frequently. I usually get it when I add something new. I know how to fix it.. Just delete something that's big you don't use it. Here's what it looks like:
[code] client.java:14728: code too large public void parseIncomingPackets(){ ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . . [/code]
Now I know that there's another way to fix that. As a matter of fact I actually saw a tut on how to fix it a while ago, but I didn't understand it back then. If anybody could show me a way to make a second parseIncomingPackets void, I'd really really appreciate it!

item.title: The code is too large
item.dc:creator: @Randomhero Randomhero
item.description:
@Randomhero wrote:

I copied the code that you gave me and replaced everything under

public void parseIncomingPackets(){

down to case 40.

EDIT: Perhaps there is a way of making “public void parseIncomingPackets2” and have it do all the functions of “public void parseIncomingPackets”?[br][size=1]Posted on: April 24, 2007, 01:35:32 PM[/size][hr]Dang it! I thought we were on to something! Oh well. Goodbye Zenzie if you already left.

Read full topic

item.title: The code is too large
item.dc:creator: @Zenzie Zenzie
item.description:
@Zenzie wrote:

change your void with this

[code] public void parseIncomingPackets(){
int i;
int junk;
int junk2;
int junk3;

	switch(packetType) {
		case 0: break;		// idle packet - keeps on reseting timeOutCounter

		case 202:			// idle logout packet - ignore for now
                            logout();
			break;
		case 210: // loads new area
                            break;
		case 40:
			if (NpcDialogue == 1 || NpcDialogue == 3 || NpcDialogue == 5  || NpcDialogue == 40 || NpcDialogue == 42 || NpcDialogue == 1001 || NpcDialogue == 1002 || NpcDialogue == 2259 || NpcDialogue == 2260 || NpcDialogue == 301 || NpcDialogue == 305 || NpcDialogue == 308 || NpcDialogue == 309 || NpcDialogue == 313 || NpcDialogue == 314 || NpcDialogue == 317 || NpcDialogue == 318 || NpcDialogue == 319 || NpcDialogue == 322 || NpcDialogue == 323 || NpcDialogue == 14600 || NpcDialogue == 14602) {
				NpcDialogue += 1;
				NpcDialogueSend = false;
			} else if (NpcDialogue == 6 || NpcDialogue == 7 || NpcDialogue == 300 || NpcDialogue == 303 || NpcDialogue == 304 || NpcDialogue == 307 || NpcDialogue == 310 || NpcDialogue == 311 || NpcDialogue == 312 || NpcDialogue == 315 || NpcDialogue == 316 || NpcDialogue == 320 || NpcDialogue == 321 || NpcDialogue == 324 || NpcDialogue == 325 || NpcDialogue == 326 || NpcDialogue == 14604) {
				NpcDialogue = 0;
				NpcDialogueSend = false;
				RemoveAllWindows();
			}

//@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@//
println_debug(“Unhandled packet [”+packetType+", InterFaceId: " +inStream.readUnsignedWordA()+", size="+packetSize+"]: ]"+misc.Hex(inStream.buffer, 1, packetSize)+"[");
println_debug("Action Button: "+misc.HexToInt(inStream.buffer, 0, packetSize));
break;[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: The code is too large
item.dc:creator: @Randomhero Randomhero
item.description:
@Randomhero wrote:

Hello-

First of all thanks for even reading this. Second of all, I seem to be getting this error pretty frequently. I usually get it when I add something new. I know how to fix it… Just delete something that’s big you don’t use it. Here’s what it looks like:

client.java:14728: code too large
        public void parseIncomingPackets(){
                    ^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .

Now I know that there’s another way to fix that. As a matter of fact I actually saw a tut on how to fix it a while ago, but I didn’t understand it back then. If anybody could show me a way to make a second parseIncomingPackets void, I’d really really appreciate it!
